name: Visions
description: What happens when the barriers between reality and fantasy, the sleeping and the waking world, the physical and the intangible begin to blur? Can you keep one foot in reality long enough to save the crew of the Enterprise-D?
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Bajoran, Borg, and Romulan Star Empire Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Wesley, Riker, or Deanna Troi will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Wesley, Riker, or Deanna Troi
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: J. Dax
featured_crew.flavor: Jadzia is upset about having missed a chance to strike out Solok and his Logicians!

featured_crew.name: Riker
featured_crew.flavor: Riker jumps out of bed and finds snakes wrapped around his leg. But a moment later they are no longer there - it was a hallucination.

action.name: I'd Be a Liar If I Said I Felt Like Myself

featured_crew.name: Troi
featured_crew.flavor: After the Enterprise finds itself drifting through a space-time anomaly, Troi becomes the only crew member who can still dream. But those dreams are nightmares during which she may not be alone.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Wesley
rewards.flavor: After befriending and assisting The Traveler, Wesley Crusher was field promoted to Acting Ensign.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: J. Dax
rewards.flavor: Jadzia is upset about having missed a chance to strike out Solok and his Logicians!

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

adventures.name: Search and Rescue
adventures.description: Use an inverse tachyon pulse to scan the anomaly.

adventures.name: Two-Way Communication
adventures.description: Use the holodeck so the creature can communicate visually.

adventures.name: Dream Log
adventures.description: Record the crew's visions and see if they provide any clues.

adventures.name: Clarity
adventures.description: Free the crew of the Enterprise-D from their nightmares.

rewards.name: Visions
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Beta Shifted
adventures.description: Send crew over to the Enterprise-D to give the crew a break.

adventures.name: REM Restored
adventures.description: Use neural impulses to help the crew get much needed rest.

adventures.name: Tachyon Tango
adventures.description: Use an antitachyon pulse to free the lifeform.

adventures.name: Clarity
adventures.description: Free the crew of the Enterprise-D from their nightmares.

rewards.name: Visions
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: Riker
rewards.flavor: Riker jumps out of bed and finds snakes wrapped around his leg. But a moment later they are no longer there - it was a hallucination.

action.name: I'd Be a Liar If I Said I Felt Like Myself

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "Captain, can you hear me? It gets harder to tell my waking hours from my nightmares with each passing day. Our entire crew has been beset by horrific visions. We need your help!"
"It isn't merely the Enterprise, though it does seem to be the worst case we're seeing. Crews throughout the fleet are having all manner of visions, nightmares, and bizarre experiences."
"What the hell!? Now I'm seeing an older version of Wes!  Captain, you gotta help us all get some relief before I lose my mind."
"Captain, can you hear me? It gets harder to tell my waking hours from my nightmares with each passing day. Our entire crew has been beset by horrific visions. We need your help!"
"It isn't merely the Enterprise, though it does seem to be the worst case we're seeing. Crews throughout the fleet are having all manner of visions, nightmares, and bizarre experiences."
"What the hell!? Now I'm seeing an older version of Wes!  Captain, you gotta help us all get some relief before I lose my mind."

"Thank you for your help, Captain. It looks like these visions and experiences all have a variety of causes as we expected, but they've all been exacerbated by the temporal anomalies and the effect those anomalies are having on space-time. Still..."

"Still, that doesn't explain our situation here, now does it, Wes? Everyone else in the galaxy got their problems resolved and we, the ones who sent out the original distress call, are still enduring a living hell."

responses.text: "Yes, calm down, Commander. Go put on some jazz and try to relax."

screens.text: "Calm down, Will. I believe our situation is linked to the anomalies as well. We were passing by one when this all started for us. And I believe that anomaly is where our answers may lie."

"Our sensors picked up intense activity like nothing we had ever seen just before the anomaly opened. Immediately after, our crew begin experiencing visions. Hearing voices. I tried to reach out to wherever the voice was coming from, but so far have been unsuccessful."

"It seems completely plausible. The situation aboard the Enterprise-D seems to have coincided with the opening of a new anomaly. Only this anomaly has remained open and nothing has come through. Still, it appears some sort of lifeform is inside - maybe trapped within."
"Captain, the next time you beam over to my ship, you might want to bring your own security detail after that little jab."
"It looks like that anomaly and whatever is stuck inside it may be the key to all of this. Captain, can we count on you a little while longer?"

"Thank you for your help, Captain. It looks like these visions and experiences all have a variety of causes as we expected, but they've all been exacerbated by the temporal anomalies and the effect those anomalies are having on space-time. Still..."

"Still, that doesn't explain our situation here, now does it, Wes? Everyone else in the galaxy got their problems resolved and we, the ones who sent out the original distress call, are still enduring a living hell."

responses.text: "Yes, calm down, Commander. Go put on some jazz and try to relax."

screens.text: "Calm down, Will. I believe our situation is linked to the anomalies as well. We were passing by one when this all started for us. And I believe that anomaly is where our answers may lie."

"Our sensors picked up intense activity like nothing we had ever seen just before the anomaly opened. Immediately after, our crew begin experiencing visions. Hearing voices. I tried to reach out to wherever the voice was coming from, but so far have been unsuccessful."

"It seems completely plausible. The situation aboard the Enterprise-D seems to have coincided with the opening of a new anomaly. Only this anomaly has remained open and nothing has come through. Still, it appears some sort of lifeform is inside - maybe trapped within."
"Captain, the next time you beam over to my ship, you might want to bring your own security detail after that little jab."
"It looks like that anomaly and whatever is stuck inside it may be the key to all of this. Captain, can we count on you a little while longer?"
